entry.et: Middle English taillour, from Anglo-French taillur, from tailler, taillier to cut, from Late Latin taliare, from Latin talea plant cutting, thin piece of wood

def.dt: :a person whose occupation is making or altering outer garments
:to do the work of a tailor
:to make or fashion as the work of a tailor
:to make or adapt to suit a special need or purpose
:to style with trim straight lines and finished handwork
:made by a tailor or with a tailor's care and style
:made or fitted especially to a particular use or purpose
:factory made rather than hand-rolled tailor–made cigarettes
:a woman's garment styled for a trim fit and with stiff straight lines
:to alter, plan, or build according to individual specifications or needs
